requirement_tested: A frontend interface for displaying a link tree with a papaya whip background and dark orange styled components
user_persona: A visitor browsing someone's shared link tree.
user_goal: View a well-styled list of links on a themed page.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Public Link Tree Page
narrative_steps.description: Sarah receives a link to her friend's link tree and opens it in her browser. She expects to see a clean and organized list of links.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the public link tree URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads with a papaya whip background and a vertical list of link cards styled with dark orange borders and text.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Links
narrative_steps.description: Sarah sees several interesting links and decides to click one. Before clicking, she hovers over it to preview.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a link card, then click the link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: On hover, the link card gains a subtle shadow effect. On click, the target URL opens in a new tab.

requirement_tested: User authentication and session management for personalized link tree access
user_persona: A returning user wanting to manage their personal link tree.
user_goal: Log in securely to access and edit their personalized link tree.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Login Process
narrative_steps.description: Alex visits the website and wants to access his personal dashboard. He finds and clicks the login option.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Login' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal or route appears showing the login form with email and password fields.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Credentials
narrative_steps.description: Alex fills in his email and password, then hits Enter to submit quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in valid credentials and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Credentials are sent via POST /api/auth/login, and Alex is redirected to his dashboard upon successful authentication.

requirement_tested: Capability for users to create their own unique link tree profile
user_persona: A newly registered user setting up their first link tree.
user_goal: Set up a unique profile that will host their personalized link tree.

narrative_steps.title: Prompted to Create Profile
narrative_steps.description: Jamie just signed up and is now asked to choose a username for their link tree profile.
narrative_steps.action: Enter a preferred username and click confirm.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A POST request is made to /api/users/profile, and the profile is created successfully with a unique identifier.

requirement_tested: Functionality to add new links to a user's link tree via form input
user_persona: An active user looking to expand their link tree.
user_goal: Add a new link to their existing collection.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Add Link Form
narrative_steps.description: Taylor notices the 'Add Link' button on their dashboard and clicks it to start adding a new resource.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Add Link' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A form with 'Title' and 'URL' input fields slides into view, matching the site’s dark orange theme.

narrative_steps.title: Entering and Validating Data
narrative_steps.description: Taylor types in a title and begins entering a malformed URL. As they type, validation kicks in.
narrative_steps.action: Type an invalid URL and observe real-time feedback.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An inline error message warns about incorrect formatting immediately during typing.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Correct Information
narrative_steps.description: After correcting the URL, Taylor clicks the submit button to finalize the addition.
narrative_steps.action: Correct the URL and click the 'Submit' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Data passes validation and is posted to /api/links; the new link appears in the list instantly.

requirement_tested: Functionality to edit existing links within a user's link tree
user_persona: A meticulous user refining their content.
user_goal: Update outdated information on one of their existing links.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Edit Mode
narrative_steps.description: Jordan realizes one of his links has changed and needs updating. He clicks the pencil icon next to the outdated link.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' icon beside a link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An editable form appears, pre-filled with the current title and URL of the selected link.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Updated Details
narrative_steps.description: Jordan modifies the URL and saves the updated information.
narrative_steps.action: Change the URL value and click 'Save Changes'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A PUT request updates the link via /api/links/{id}, and the changes reflect immediately in the displayed link tree.

requirement_tested: Functionality to delete unwanted links from a user's link tree
user_persona: A user cleaning up old or irrelevant entries.
user_goal: Remove a redundant link from their personal link tree.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering Deletion
narrative_steps.description: Casey no longer uses a particular link and wants to remove it permanently from her list.
narrative_steps.action: Click the trash bin icon next to the unwanted link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A confirmation dialog pops up asking if Casey really wants to delete the link.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Removal
narrative_steps.description: After confirming, Casey watches as the link disappears from her list.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Confirm' in the dialog box.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A DELETE request is sent to /api/links/{id}, and the link vanishes from the UI seamlessly.

requirement_tested: Backend API endpoints for CRUD operations on user link data
user_goal: Verify all basic create, read, update, and delete actions work correctly through API calls.

narrative_steps.title: Creating New Link Entry
narrative_steps.description: Using an API client tool, the developer creates a new link entry under a known user ID.
narrative_steps.action: Send POST request to /api/links with valid payload.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server responds with 201 Created and returns the newly added link object.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching All User Links
narrative_steps.description: The developer retrieves the full list of links belonging to the authenticated user.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/links.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns a JSON array containing all links linked to the user’s account.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Existing Link
narrative_steps.description: The developer modifies one attribute of an existing link record.
narrative_steps.action: Send PUT request to /api/links/{id} with updated data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server responds with 200 OK and reflects the change in the returned object.

narrative_steps.title: Deleting Specific Link
narrative_steps.description: Finally, the developer deletes a specific link entry entirely.
narrative_steps.action: Send DELETE request to /api/links/{id}.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Response code 204 No Content confirms successful removal without body.

requirement_tested: Backend service connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: System administrator deploying the backend service.
user_goal: Ensure proper database connectivity upon backend initialization.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Admin sets the correct environment variables and boots up the backend server.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in backend directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Application logs indicate successful connection to PostgreSQL using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432 etc.

requirement_tested: Database schema design supporting users and their associated links
user_goal: Validate that the database tables properly represent user-link relationships.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Table Structures
narrative_steps.description: Architect reviews how user identities map to collections of links stored in separate tables.
narrative_steps.action: Query database metadata for table schemas.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Users table contains id, username, created_at; Links table contains id, user_id (foreign key), title, url, position, created_at.

requirement_tested: Shareable public URL generation for each user's link tree
user_persona: Content creator ready to distribute their curated links.
user_goal: Obtain a unique, shareable URL representing their personal link tree.

narrative_steps.title: Profile Setup Completion
narrative_steps.description: Morgan finishes setting up their profile and looks for ways to share it publicly.
narrative_steps.action: Complete profile setup process.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Upon completion, Morgan sees a generated public URL like '/u/morgan_links' assigned automatically.

requirement_tested: Public view page rendering a user's link tree without requiring login
user_persona: Guest visitor exploring a shared link tree.
user_goal: Access and navigate a user's public link tree anonymously.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Shared Link Tree
narrative_steps.description: Patricia receives a link to someone's public link tree and opens it in her browser.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the shared public URL such as '/u/example_user'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page renders a styled list of links similar to logged-in view but excludes edit/delete options.

requirement_tested: Responsive UI layout ensuring compatibility across devices
user_persona: Mobile-first user accessing the platform on different screen sizes.
user_goal: Seamlessly use the application whether on desktop or mobile device.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Browser Window
narrative_steps.description: Dana resizes her browser window to simulate various device widths and checks responsiveness.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window width below 768px threshold.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts dynamically—cards stack vertically, margins/padding reduce accordingly, preserving usability.

requirement_tested: Form validation for link inputs including URL format checking
user_persona: Detail-oriented user submitting carefully crafted content.
user_goal: Avoid accidental submission of malformed URLs through proactive validation.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Malformed URL
narrative_steps.description: While filling out the add-link form, Sam mistakenly enters an incomplete URL.
narrative_steps.action: Leave the URL input field after typing something like 'htp:/example.com'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Inline validation triggers and displays a warning: 'Please enter a valid URL starting with http(s)'.

requirement_tested: Loading states and error handling during API requests
user_goal: Receive clear feedback when performing actions reliant on backend communication.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Long-Running Action
narrative_steps.description: Riley adds a new link and waits for the server to respond, expecting some visual indication of progress.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Submit' on the add link form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A spinner overlay appears over the affected section indicating ongoing activity.

narrative_steps.title: Encountering Network Error
narrative_steps.description: Due to poor internet, Riley experiences a timeout during the operation.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for API call to fail due to timeout.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Toast notification pops up saying 'Network error – please try again later'.

requirement_tested: Concurrent development server setup for both frontend and backend
user_persona: Frontend developer beginning joint development workflow.
user_goal: Start both frontend and backend servers simultaneously with minimal effort.

narrative_steps.title: Booting Full Stack Locally
narrative_steps.description: Dev wants to launch everything together instead of running multiple terminals manually.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` from root project folder.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend servers boot concurrently using concurrently package, logging outputs side-by-side.
